page.title: 08Crathie Parish Social Life
page.content: The social life of the parish is mainly centred on visiting relatives and friends in their homes. There are badminton sessions held in the Church hall. The Women's Guild meet regularly as do the Crathie and Birkhall Womens Rural Institute. There is a curling club in the Winter, also cricket and golf clubs for the Summer months. An Old People's Welfare Committee runs a splendid lunch party at Christmas. Santa Claus meets every child in the parish at the Women's Guild Christmas Party. Regular whist drives attract people even in cold winter weather to come from Braemar or Ballater and there are occasional concerts and ceilidhs. Summer picnics are run by the Sunday School and WRI and there is generally a full turn out for these even if June is a cold month.
